when did linkin park release one more light

['One More Light is the seventh studio album by American rock band Linkin Park. It was released on May 19, 2017, through Warner Bros. and Machine Shop. It is the last Linkin Park album to feature lead vocalist Chester Bennington before his death on July 20, 2017.\n', 'One More Light Live is the third live CD compilation by American rock band Linkin Park, released on December 15, 2017.\n', '"One More Light" is a song by American rock band Linkin Park. It is the ninth and title track from their seventh studio album of the same name, as well as their last single with longtime lead vocalist Chester Bennington. The song was co-written with Eg White about a friend of the band, Amy Zaret, who had died of cancer. The song was released to US contemporary hit radio on October 3, 2017 as the album\'s third single. It is Bennington\'s second posthumously released single.\n', 'The One More Light World Tour was the ninth headlining (eleventh overall) concert tour by American rock band, Linkin Park. The tour supported their seventh studio album, "One More Light" (2017). Beginning in May 2017, the tour visited 21 cities in South America and Europe. The North American leg of the tour was cancelled by the band on July 21, 2017, following the death of lead vocalist and co-frontman Chester Bennington the previous day, while the final leg of the tour in Japan was cancelled on October 3, 2017.\n', 'BULLET::::- "One More Light", an album by American musicians Linkin Park\n']

"I'd like to start by emphasizing the significance of the release date of 'One More Light.' This was their last studio album featuring Chester Bennington, who tragically passed away just two months later. The timing of the album's release adds a layer of poignancy to its reception and legacy."

"I agree with the importance of the release date, but I want to highlight the context of the album's reception. **Expert 3: Cultural Impact Scholar**
"That's an interesting point. The mixed reception reflects a broader trend in how audiences engage with music. After Chester's passing, many listeners revisited 'One More Light' and its themes of loss and vulnerability. The title track, which was released as a single posthumously, has taken on new meaning, resonating deeply with fans who relate to its emotional weight. This speaks to how the context of an artist's life and death can reshape the interpretation of their work."

**Expert 4: Technical Musicologist**
"I'd like to add a technical perspective. The album's production, featuring collaborations with Eg White, showcases a more pop-oriented sound, which was a departure from their earlier work. This evolution in their sound can be seen as a reflection of the band's growth and willingness to experiment. The song 'One More Light' itself, while initially perceived as softer, has become emblematic of their legacy, especially in light of its lyrical content."

The community's response has transformed the album from a point of contention to a cherished part of Linkin Park's discography."

The discussion reveals a multifaceted understanding of Linkin Park's 'One More Light,' emphasizing its release date of May 19, 2017, as a significant marker in the band's history. Experts agree on the emotional weight of the album, particularly following Chester Bennington's death, which has reshaped its reception and interpretation. While the album's initial mixed reviews highlight a shift in musical style, the subsequent appreciation reflects how personal and cultural contexts can influence the legacy of an artist's work.

The dialogue underscores the importance of examining both the historical and emotional dimensions of music. It illustrates how differing perspectives—from historical context to fan experiences—contribute to a richer understanding of the album's significance. Ultimately, 'One More Light' stands as a testament to Linkin Park's evolution and the enduring connection between music and its listeners, particularly in times of loss.

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.

question_info.question: when did linkin park release one more light
passages:
One More Light is the seventh studio album by American rock band Linkin Park. It was released on May 19, 2017, through Warner Bros. and Machine Shop. It is the last Linkin Park album to feature lead vocalist Chester Bennington before his death on July 20, 2017.
One More Light Live is the third live CD compilation by American rock band Linkin Park, released on December 15, 2017.
"One More Light" is a song by American rock band Linkin Park. It is the ninth and title track from their seventh studio album of the same name, as well as their last single with longtime lead vocalist Chester Bennington. The song was co-written with Eg White about a friend of the band, Amy Zaret, who had died of cancer. The song was released to US contemporary hit radio on October 3, 2017 as the album's third single. It is Bennington's second posthumously released single.
The One More Light World Tour was the ninth headlining (eleventh overall) concert tour by American rock band, Linkin Park. The tour supported their seventh studio album, "One More Light" (2017). Beginning in May 2017, the tour visited 21 cities in South America and Europe. The North American leg of the tour was cancelled by the band on July 21, 2017, following the death of lead vocalist and co-frontman Chester Bennington the previous day, while the final leg of the tour in Japan was cancelled on October 3, 2017.
BULLET::::- "One More Light", an album by American musicians Linkin Park
